arts.ttl: Reading boss left 'pleased' with performance in Birmingham City stalemate
arts.sum: Reading boss Noel Hunt was left pleased with his sides performance during a battling 0-0 draw against league leaders Birmingham City. Chances were kept at a premium for both sides but it extends the Blues' lead to 10 points at the summit and makes it 17 unbeaten, while the Royals are ninth and five unbeaten. Take a look below at immediate reaction from Hunt. Hunt on result

arts.ttl: Chris Davies teases Lyndon Dykes and Alfie May solution to Birmingham City problem
arts.sum: Chris Davies has teased the idea of starting both Lyndon Dykes and Alfie May at Reading as Birmingham City look to replace Jay Stansfield’s goals. “Lyndon’s been in really good form actually and I was really pleased for him to get that goal because he’s been a little bit unlucky to come out of the team, just through my own decision making, because of the impact he has made in certain games.

arts.ttl: Chris Davies gives updates on Wright and Dykes after Birmingham City duo limp off at Reading
arts.sum: Chris Davies is braced for his Birmingham City squad to be tested after Scott Wright and Lyndon Dykes’ names were added to the injury list. Scott Wright and Lyndon Dykes limped off during Birmingham City's 0-0 draw with Reading on Saturday

arts.ttl: Birmingham City player ratings after Dykes denied winner in Reading draw
arts.sum: Willum Willumsson, who replaced Wright early on, had a good chance to score at the other end shortly before half-time. The goal was gaping for Lyndon Dykes to give Blues the lead shortly after half-time.

arts.ttl: Reading hold runaway League One leaders Birmingham City to lunchtime stalemate
arts.sum: Reading held League One leaders Birmingham City to a very credible 0-0 draw at the Select Car Leasing. Chris Davies' Blues are unbeaten in 16 and sat 10 points clear at the top of League One ahead of this afternoon's fixtures while Reading extended their run to five unbeaten with a tight contest on a difficult surface. In a low-key first half, either goalkeeper was tested as both teams looked to find it difficult on a bumpy surface. It took 15 minutes for the Royals to have their only shot of the half, Mamadi Camara letting fly from distance and forcing Ryan Allsop into a catch. The Blues, looking jaded from a midweek outing in the EFL Trophy, failed to test Joel Pereira and were forced into an early substitution as Scott Wright fell innocuously on the turf. Tyler Bindon was forced into an important intervention after 20 minutes, clearing just in front of the goal line after the Royals gave the ball away on the edge of their own penalty box.

arts.ttl: Leaders Birmingham extend unbeaten run but have to settle for point at Reading
arts.sum: Blues have not lost in the league since November.

arts.ttl: Live updates: League leaders in town as Birmingham City make Reading trip
arts.sum: Reading look to end League One leader's Birmingham City's 16-match unbeaten streak in this afternoon's early kick-off. Over 3,000 Blues are travelling to the SCL Stadium as the Royals look to cause an upset and keep their play-off ambitions alive.

arts.ttl: Reading team news: One change made for visit of League One leaders Birmingham City
arts.sum: Reading have made just one change for this afternoon's early kick-off with League One leaders Birmingham City. Chris Davies' side are unbeaten in 16 matches and sit nine points clear at the summit, but are without the division's top scorer Jay Stansfield after he was stretchered off in Tuesday's EFL Trophy win. Having spent over £30m in the summer, Birmingham are targeting a League One and Vertu Trophy double, not done since Bristol City a decade ago. Noel Hunt's side, sat ninth, are unbeaten in four and held Birmingham to a 1-1 draw at St Andrew's on the opening day in August.

arts.ttl: I knew I'd end up on Soccer AM after what happened for Birmingham City vs Aston Villa
arts.sum: Birmingham City had some memorable moments in their Premiership clashes with Aston Villa - this wasn't one of them Former Birmingham City star David Dunn has revealed how his failed Rabona against Aston Villa in 2003 came back to haunt him.

arts.ttl: Saturday's League One predictions including Reading vs. Birmingham
arts.sum: Sports Mole provides score predictions and previews for all of today's League One fixtures, including Reading vs. Birmingham.
